questions.question: I would rather ………… alone.
questions.description: After modal auxiliary verbs, the infinitive is used without to.

questions.question: How dare you ………….. me a stupid?
questions.description: When dare is used as a modal auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: Need I ……………. any longer?
questions.description: When need is used as a modal auxiliary verb, it is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: You had better ……………. her what she wants.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after had better.

questions.question: My mother does not let me …………….. up late.
questions.description: Let is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: They made him …………….. the place.
questions.description: Make is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: I saw him ……………… in.
questions.description: See is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: She was heard ……………… that she was disappointed.
questions.description: In passive structures with hear, the infinitive is used with to.

questions.question: I was made …………….
questions.description: In passive structures with make, the infinitive is used with to.

questions.question: We heard him ……………. that he was quitting.
questions.description: Hear is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: Did you feel the earth …………….?
questions.description: Feel is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: The doctor advised me ……………. smoking.
questions.description: Advise is followed by object + infinitive with to.
